Reviews.Title: “Vladimir from Moscow, Russia”
Reviews.Author: vladimir p
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service. The staff were super friendly and willing to help us all time. Nice and comfortable room, the breakfast was good. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again in the future

Reviews.Title: “A very good - but not perfect - stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dyrewolf
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that Villa Madame is in a fantastic location, just steps from plenty of eateries, Metro stops, and boutique shops. The St-Suplice area is a great area to stay. The hotel itself was extremely nicely apportioned, and our room, while very small (we got the classic), was well-maintained and nice. The staff, while not necessarily outgoing, was helpful when asked. Our biggest complaint was that the hotel is next to an elementary school, and from about 9:30am onward M-F, there were kids playing in the schoolyard with the occasional school bell. This wasn't a distant sound - it was extremely up close and personal if you were trying to sleep in. We had a 5th floor room with a veranda overlooking the garden (#52), so we may have gotten the worst of the sound. When we brought it up to the staff, they told us there were double pane windows, and that's all they could do. I stayed in a hotel in Florence where our window opened to a busy street - but they had soundproof glass and we never heard a peep. Villa Madame needs to know that "double pane" and "soundproof" are not the same thing. It would be a great upgrade to the hotel. If you are a traveler who is up and out at 8am, don't worry about the noise, but if you want to eat and drink until the wee hours and sleep in (at least during the school year), maybe there's a better hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAlan
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay enormously. The courtyard off reception is perfect as is the library. Nicely sized rooms, good bathrooms, very clean and with nice staff. Good location and 2 minutes walk to the Metro. Agree with reviewers who said the Garden Rooms would be noisy given there location off the courtyard. Personally didn't find the school next door caused any issues. Great place and highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rgars
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for only night before returning to New York but we will be back. The staff, especially Eric, were very accommodating and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated. After mentioning it was our anniversary to Eric we left the hotel and returned to find a chilled complimentary bottle of champagne in our room. Thank you. Great location near some really good restaurants and shopping. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul E
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a weekend and loved the hotel. Situated in a quiet street within easy walking distance to attractive bars, brasseries and the tourist sights! The room was fairly small (the table made it a tight fit), but very comfortable, quiet and attractively decorated. Lovely comfortable big beds with excellent en-suite facilities, including bath and shower. The lounge and bar are extremely welcoming with beautiful furnishings and pictures. Very helpful and friendly staff. All in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with style in nice neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: apprendrelemonde
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel is happily situated in very chic and nice neighborhood, far away from the horribly masses of 9th and 8th districts. Jardin de Luxembourg just around the corner, as well as many connecting metro- and bus-lines. Hotel's lobby and bar are really nice and a little terrace is a huge plus. Rooms are tidy, bathroom though is not that "wonderful", it gets really warm and steamy while taking shower and the bathroom door could not stay open...minor detail but annoyed a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Villa Madame for a week starting on December 28th. Our room (a double deluxe) was very spacious, clean and comfortable. There was plenty of storage space for our stuff and the iPod docking station and free wifi were greatly appreciated. The staff was pleasant and helpful. I agree with other reviewers that the price of breakfast is a bit much (18 euros for the full breakfast downstairs in the dining room and 14 euros for a continental breakfast in your room). We did have the full breakfast one morning and it's good, but I would recommend that if you don't want a big breakfast, go out to one of the excellent cafes or patisseries in the area for some nice vienoiserie (croissants, pain au chocolat), coffee and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel..!”
Reviews.Author: dbtlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over NYE on our ״mini moon" following a recommendation and loved it. Hi quality facilities and impeccable service made us very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Christmas in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Heidi189934
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel and we definitely enjoyed our stay! Our room (36) was spacious, comfortable and beautiful. Also the bathroom was lovely. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially José! The breakfast was delicious and it was definitely worth its price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingRiyadh
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is situated in the Saint Germaine area of Paris so is very central and just a short walk to Metro and bus lines. The hotel offers a small room but adequate for Paris with a little sitting area and separate washroom with tub/toilet facility....free internet and a docking system is a nice feature. It is a little pricey considering breakfast isn't included - nor did they have a coffee machine in the room and therefore only 3 star in my opinion. The garden provides a nice place to have a drink prior to going out in the evening. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Paris is Paris and great breakfast, crepe, meals are only a short walk away. All in all it was a good stay in a centrally located hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mellifera23
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights here and enjoyed the location of this hotel very much. It's a shame that breakfast is not included in the somewhat pricey room rates. We chose to go to one of the nearby cafes instead, as the charge of 18 euros per person seemed very high. Contrary to the website, not all executive rooms have a bathtub. We asked to change rooms because of this, and it was arranged in a polite and friendly manner. We stayed in the back of the hotel, facing away from the street, and the school next door was definitely audible during the day, even with closed windows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel, from breakfast to bed.”
Reviews.Author: MasterBoneco
Reviews.Content: We got this recomendation from a friend that also have a boutique hotel. We booked our room and after a while four other rooms were booked by family members, we all stayed a full week in Paris. Location of this hotel is excellent. One of the couples in our party rented a car and was able to park in the nearby streets every night, but there are 3 subway stations nearby, like 2 blocks away, so, car is really not needed. Breakfast is on the expensive side, but nonetheless excellent. Small rooms, but very nice décor. School on the side is not a problem, there are at least two good bakeries/ cafés less than a block away and a small and efficient supermarket (Monop). Cafe de Flore/ Le Deux Magots are 2 blocks away, and St. Sulpice, 1 and a half, as well as the fantastic Luxembourg Gardens. So, a very highly recommended hotel in a very special neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: GECDUB
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) recently stayed at the Hotel for 4 nights in their standard rooms -- 1 room off the garden and 1 in the main building.Both rooms were on the small side but the quality of the rooms more than compensated for their size.Breakfast was excellent.The hotels main asset in our eyes were all their staff who were very professional and looked after all our needs exceptionally well.The location of the hotel is excellent close to shops sights and restaurants. If you are travelling to Paris for a short trip i would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “nice located cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruedesecouffes
Reviews.Content: Situated in a quiet street, it's a nice hotel to stay if you'd like to spend several days in St.Germain area. We stayed in an executive room which is relatively large for hotels in Paris. Walking distance to jardin du Luxembourg, St.Sulpice and also to Bon marche. Lift was quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: tpadvisorwalker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last week. We recieved a very friendly welcome and were shown to a beautiful room on the 5th floor complete with roof terrace - couldn't have been better. As we were celebrating a special birthday we were given a complimentary bottle of champagne which was enjoyed on the terrace after a busy day's sightseeing. This area near the Luxembourg Gardens is a winner - we stayed in a hotel nearby for our first visit to Paris last summer but the Villa Madame although much more expensive than the previous was the icing on our stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location, clean & comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Shashindra
Reviews.Content: 6 nights in the Executive Room was really nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Mr.Frederic. Highly recommended and thumbs high for Villa Madame

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Relaxetta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Executive Suite for a week. The room was surprisingly spacious and luxurious with beautiful art and special touches. The reception staff, breakfast staff and room attendants were outstanding! They provided cheery service of the highest standard. The breakfast was sumptuos and, while not included in the daily charge, was definitely worth the extra. Do enjoy it in the beautiful garden at least once! We noticed that this hotel received an award for the best plant displays throughout Europe; well deserved. The location was perfect; so quiet you wouldn't know you were in the middle of Paris yet we walked everywhere with ease. This hotel exceeded our expectations and we couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SYKAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the garden suites (room 1), a good sized and well appointed room for 4 nights. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful and their recommendations for restaurants were excellent. They were more than happy to book and re-book restaurants and taxis for us and recommend places to go and visit. The hotel is located in a quiet street is St Germain but is very close to the heart of this area being only a 2 to 3 minute walk from Saint Sulplice. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but the boulangerie on the corner of the street near the hotel has excellent croissant and baguettes or a short walk away is the fabulous Gerard Mulot. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within a 15 minute walk. All the rooms are either king or twiin beds and ther are a few interconnecting rooms for families. We would certainly look to stay here again on a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbreur
Reviews.Content: "lovely hotel very nicely located near the "jardin du luxembourg", excellent staff, nice rooms!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and wanted to stay longer-We'll be back with our friends”
Reviews.Author: robinw238
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel in a perfect area on the left bank. The hotel location, beautiful decor, and absolutely wonderful staff really made our short weekend visit to Paris a great success. For those who have never been to Paris-I would strongly recommend it. The staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations for dining. We were upgraded to an Executive room that overlooked the garden. We had a wonderful breakfast in the garden and drinks later after coming back from a long day sightseeing. It is a real gem-they also have bicycles you can rent. Enjoy. Robin & Lindsay , Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Single mom with 3 kids!”
Reviews.Author: priscilla d
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing for location, cleanliness, helpfulness and safe for myself and 3 kids, 16, 12, 8. The staff could not have been more helpful, kind, and amazing! We had two rooms adjoining, one with twin beds, and one with a double...it was great! The beds are the comfiest around! Would def stay there again! Also highly recco taking the Fat Tire tour of Versaille with kids!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Most Charming Hotels in Paris that We've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: jknyart
Reviews.Content: Reception was excellent. Our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable; had one of the best showers we've ever had in Paris. The area of the 6th arrondisement where it's located is truly marvellous; it's convenient to the Luxembourg Gardens but also to great shopping, dining, et al. For those who prefer an area that's a bit away from the hubbub it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will come back next time in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Niushork
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here from August 2 to August 3. Arrived around 11.15am and the room was ready, which was a nice surprise. The room was very well maintained, you could see that the hotel has been renovated or refurbished not a long time ago. The bathroom was clean, full of light and with Hermes products. The bed was a real pleasure and since we were with our little baby the hotel provided a travel bed for our boy. We did not have time to try the restaurant, but it looked good and also the little inside garden, quite a nice touch. Service was impeccable and the front desk very friendly. There is a nice living room with a huge sofa and also in a small corner the computer for internet access. We will definitely come back next time we are in Paris. Plus is a nice cafe right in the corner with a boulangerie opposite selling amazing patisserie. On the same street you can find the APC store. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A la prochaine!”
Reviews.Author: mexo
Reviews.Content: Villa Madame is close to several Metros and easy walking distance to the Luxembourg Gardens, the shops and restaurants of St Germain and the Latin Quarter. Arriving after a hot and dusty train ride across France, it was a cool oasis of calm and comfort. We were greeted warmly and shown to a room in which we were a little disappointed in terms of size. We have stayed in Paris many, many times and are under no illusion about the average room size. Perhaps it was because we had spent most of the day in a stuffy, cramped train carriage - we just wanted more space, so we asked and were moved without problem to a slightly larger one, but it made all the difference. The decor is muted and very chic, fabrics soft and crisp appropriately and the hotel is very clean. The bathrooms are shiny and white with delicious Hermes products. I'm afraid I have to admit to not being able to leave my orange flower body lotion and potions behind! I hope you'll let me come back...... The bedding was extremely comfortable - we slept well - and there were little extras like slippers and complementary mineral water in the fridge, replenished daily. All of the above is what one would expect from a 4* hotel, but what makes Villa Madame that bit special was the following: * Very friendly and helpful reception staff. We needed to confirm a very hard-to-get reservation at a fashionably elusive restaurant. The receptionist persevered on our behalf and he got hold of them, standing for none of their nonsense, or else they would have turned us away.......but that's another review! * Beautiful little shaded garden in which one can chat, read, order tea or drinks at any time. There are candles and blankets for chilly nights. *Lovely salon with many books and games at your disposal and a fire which would be cosy in the Winter. There is a small bar which was never occupied, but looked as if it would be fun if it were. *All the extra touches around the hotel like drawings, paintings and photos. Not the usual hotel bland stuff, but GOOD, interesting pieces. (We are design lecturers, so we notice that stuff.) The candles, the objets d'art, the plants - all engendering an atmosphere of mutual respect between hotel and guest. We didn't have breakfast as we preferred to lie in and then wander off for a coffee, perhaps to the Luxembourg Gardens. There is a friendly neighborhood cafe almost opposite. But we did order beers, wine and teas in the garden, none of which was overpriced. (Though I would have liked a little biscuit or macaroon with my tea.) I look forward to another excuse to visit the Villa Madame and would recommend it to friends as a quiet and romantic, grown up destination with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayanto
Reviews.Content: Really loved this hotel, it was beautifully decorated (very much interior designed) and was spotlessly clean. We had a booked a superior double and when we arrived we were told we'd been upgraded. The room was fairly large by Paris standards and had a day bed, which I assume could sleep a 3rd person/child. The bathroom was really modern and had a bath and large separate shower with large overhead shower head, plus hand held shower. All the decor was tasteful and we were at the back of the hotel overlooking the small courtyard garden, so very quiet, although the hotel is on a quiet street anyway. Short walk to the Jardin du Luxembourg and less that 5 mins to a metro, which was on a direct line to the Gare du Nord, so perfect for us as we took the Eurostar from London. Hotel booked us a table at a great restaurant, superb food, which they recommended. Breakfast was served to order and you got croissants, pain au chocolat, bread and could choose omelettes etc. The fruit salad was freshly made, the yoghurts were the posh ones in glass jars. Would really recommend the hotel, but not for small children - there are a lot of carefully placed vases and objets d'art that little fingers will want to touch...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cherrywynn
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Villa Madame. Our room in this boutique hotel was nicely furnished, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom had been recently renovated and was absolutely devine! All staff were helpful and pleasant. We loved being nestled in this St. Germaine neighborhood that was conveniently located to everything. It gave us a sense of the daily experience of Parisians living in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for what it is!”
Reviews.Author: Dodonian
Reviews.Content: We don't live far from Paris. Therefore we are regular visitors. For exhibitions or just for leisure. We have experienced many nice hotels, cheap and expensive, as well as bad. As many gave reported before, everybody should be aware that rooms in Paris are tiny, compared to the industry standards or mean values. We had booked two rooms for two couples. None of us was satisfied with the equipment, service and pricing. Welcome was Parisian-cold and breakfast was so expensive at an already expensive rate, that we better had a couple of cookies and croissants at the bakery next door! Of course St Germain is one of the most expensive quarters of Paris. Nevertheless amenities and service should correspond to pricing and not be considered a "quartier" standard.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect and lovely !”
Reviews.Author: Markymark002
Reviews.Content: What can I say but woooooow ! It was our first time in Paris, my wife and I, and we were for for the least bit delighted! On our first night the staff recommended us a great restaurant right by the hotel (Le petit Lux). We had a lovely evening. On our second day we went wandering around the streets of Paris, we were lucky the weather was on our side! When coming back to the hotel we were welcomed by an accordeon concert right in the hotel! We can honestly say that we received the full Parisian experience. We stayed only two nights but wished we could have stayed more! The staff was simply wonderful and mighty helpful. We had a taxi driver to pick us up right in front of the hotel to sadly take us back to Sweden. No doubt our next in Paris will be in the Villa Madame! See you soon guys. Mark and Debby

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a luxurious weekend escape.”
Reviews.Author: Kristinandcrew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just had a wonderful weekend getaway to Paris and were delighted we chose Villa Madame. We arrived at Gare du Nord on the Eurostar and after taking one look at the huge queue for taxis, decided to hop on the Metro instead. It couldn't have been easier--a straight shot on the Number 4 to Sainte Sulpice and a few minutes walk to the hotel. The location was ideal--quiet and peaceful, yet walkable to everything. Villa Madame is located just on the doorstep of beautiful Sainte-Sulpice, the relaxing Jardins du Luxembourg and the interesting boutiques and restaurants of Sainte Germain du Pres. The Hotel was very accommodating and per request, gave us a room with a double bed (not two singles pushed together) and terrace and also happily organized dinner reservations for our first night and several taxis during our stay. Although our room seemed small at first glance, the design made it surprisingly spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in! We loved the modern and chic decor, the quality of the linens and towels and soft furnishings. All in all, a perfect place for our weekend away--especially if like us, you prefer small boutique hotels with character and warm, personal service. Our only request would be to ask the housekeeping staff to gently close the room doors in the mornings when cleaning--our precious lie-ins away from our four lovely children were interrupted a bit by slamming doors!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly comfortable well located small Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: gutflam5
Reviews.Content: Read other reviews first as they are generally accurate. Strengths as follows: Superb, helpful, kind staff. Concierge eager to please, resourceful, and accessible. Phenomenally good breakfast served by a tirelessly cheerful hostess. This is a family run establishment at it's best. The location is in a residential Parisian neighborhood next door to an upscale elementary school, close to Lux gardens. The wife was a little bothered by morning noise from the school kids. This won't be a problem soon on summer holiday. I enjoyed seeing paris's finest dropping the kiddies off in the AM. And up the block is a terrific patisserie and around the corner are two food stores for light provisions and waters. Wine store is 50 yards away. Eat at Bistrot d'Henry, suggested by hotel, best meal ever. See review. Piddling criticisms to keep review honest: 273 Euros a night ain't cheap, but don't blame Villa Madam, blame your debased dollar. 5 pieces of laundry at the cleaners around the corner, washed not pressed or dry cleaned, was 13 E. Pressed, 51 E. Lunch at a sidewalk Brasserie for four, over 100 E. And breakfast at the hotel is a great experience. The carpets in the rooms could have been cleaner. The soap and toiletries should have been replaced on day three without us asking. Honestly, that stuff is irrelevant. I'd stay here again anytime. Oh, I forgot, bed is uber comfortable, shower strong, towels big, tv fine, A/C as cold as you need it.

Reviews.Title: “clean,modern amenities but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: browneye06
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at Villa Madame with my teenage daughter. The location is great for left bank,close to metro,Luxembourg gardens and many places to eat. While the property is clean and modern,villa Madame fell short of my expectations of a 4 star hotel. Examples: No clocks in the room and when I called on two separate evenings to front desk for a wake up call,they never answered. I requested extra towels one evening and was told this was impossible as housekeeping was gone till the next day. The elevator was extremely small,only two people at a time and was very temperamental.Most hotels sell Museum Passes and have info regarding tours etc,Villa Madame did not. We brought our luggage up and down ourselves via the small elevator,no concierge.We stayed in an executive room,larger then the standard room and faced the street which was noisy in the mornings as a school is next door. Pros...clean,modern and quaint in a good location but more like a 3 star property.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: OsloMikkel
Reviews.Content: High quality hotel with superb location in a quiet street. We had an absoulutly delightful stay. Very freiendly and service minded staff. beautiful decorated room with a very good bed. Breakfast was very nice with a wide selection. Some noice from next door school, but we were not disturbed by it. The hotel was so nice that we were tempted to keep it a secret - but we choosed not to

Reviews.Title: “Jewel of a hotel with expensive champagne!”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningNEEngland
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, small hotel in a smart location near to the Jardin du Luxembourg. It is centrally located and within walking distance of The Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Musee Rodin, the Seine and other significant Parisian sights. It is also close to wonderful shops and restaurants. The rooms are very well appointed, modern, very clean and well maintained. The staff were friendly, courteous, very helpful and considerate of our limited French! However it is worth noting that the champagne ( if consumed by the bottle is VERY EXPENSIVE!) My husband ordered a bottle thinking that it would be less expensive than buying x4 glasses. ( NB. We were NOT offered a wine list) A fatal error! The bottle was considerably more expensive than 8 glasses! Despite this (we won't be buying the champagne there for pre-dinner drinks!!) we would certainly choose to stay in the Villa Madame on any subsequent visits to Paris. A jewel in a lovely Parisian location.

Reviews.Title: “Getting even better”
Reviews.Author: cat82London
Reviews.Content: This was my second weekend visit to Villa Madam. Stayed here a couple of years ago just after it had changed owners and had gone thro’ a stylish re vamp. All the initial teething troubles have vanished and we were made to feel very comfortable & welcome even lucky enough to have a room up-grade. Great location for the park and endless retail and eating experiences. Rue Madam is very quiet at night so with such a comfortable bed and silence I slept very well. Will return

Reviews.Title: “So helpful in a crisis”
Reviews.Author: sevencats
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this beautiful, elegant little hotel. What stands out for me is how the staff responded in a crisis. My husband was hit by a bus while we were on our 30th anniversary vacation. It would take me pages to describe everything the hotel management and staff did to help me. Everyone was so helpful, but the help provided by the night-manager, Herve Luc Becker, went beyond anything I could have imagined. He was there for me every night when I came back from the hospital with tea and comfort, and made countless phone calls for me. When it became clear that I would need to extend my stay, he visited some appartment hotels on his day off, and found me a suitable place. He took me there and gave me a tour of the neighborhood. He checked on me every day and continued to help until we were able to leave Paris 2 weeks later. Wow! I am so lucky that I met such a wonderful person.

Reviews.Title: “At Villa Madame, you'll feel special.”
Reviews.Author: Knooster
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa Madame is an extremely fine experience. Let me count the ways: 1. Very trendy and stylish. 2. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. 3. Reasonably priced. 4. Well located. Close to St. Germain des Pres and Luxembourg Gardens. Metro is close and easy. 5. The staff is extremely cordial, helpful....completely fluent with English and patient with my crappy French. Franck, Herve Luc, Sonia, and Camille get high marks for customer service. Ask for them personally. You won't be disappointed. 6. Quiet at night. Unlike other Paris hotels, Rue Madame is quiet at night and it's easy to get a good night sleep. We stayed for three weeks at Villa Madame last year and liked it so much that we returned for another three weeks this year. We'd like to go again next year, God willing. Please contact me personally KNOOSTER@aol.com for more info. I'm happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aquaticdoc
Reviews.Content: I spent a wonderful week at the Villa Madame, finding the staff very helpful and gracious. My 5th floor room was very clean and light, quiet, and comfortable. The hotel is extremely well located only a few short blocks to the metro, Jardins du Luxemburg, and shopping. The hotel offered free wifi, and much more surprisingly, free international telephone service from my room via voip. Breakfasts were excellent, and the garden area was quiet and comfortable. Just around the corner is Maison du Jardin, a very excellent small restaurant with prix fixe 31 euro dinners. Staff made other great recommendations as well. I would unhesitatingly recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but not great if you arrive early in the morning on an international flight”
Reviews.Author: luluworldtravel
Reviews.Content: Positives: This hotel had a great location by the Luxembourg gardens and the decoration in the main entrance is stunning; I loved the neighborhood and being able to walk out the door and into tons of interesting streets. It is a 5 minute or so walk to the gardens and you can jog/walk/visit easily. That is why I chose this particular hotel since I love to start out my day with a jog in the gardens. Negatives: I would not recommend this hotel if you arrive early in the morning and hope to check in. I arrived around 6am after being on an overnight flight from Africa. My room was not ready until 12:30pm (2pm is the normal check in time) so I had to wait in the hotel lobby living room all those hours when all I wanted to do was catch a nap, shower and then get out and explore. This is not the hotel's fault, but it is a reason to stay at a larger chain that has more rooms (this hotel did have some open rooms but not at my fare) so that you can check in should you arrive really early or late. The thing that really bothered me about this hotel though was that the staff at the front desk. The main lady who was there when I arrived early morning was not very friendly and just said there was nothing she could do about my early arrival. I understand given that I arrived before check in time, however she was not welcoming, did not offer me the bathroom or water or tea or anything to make my wait more comfortable, and I sat there for hours and hours, freezing cold with a scarf wrapped around my head. I eventually confronted her about this reception and we worked it out and made peace and she was pleasant the next two days I was there. Still, for all the money I would hope for something a bit more welcoming upon arrival! Once I got to my room is was very nice-very tasteful decoration- but teeny tiny and barely enough room for one person and a suitcase. Seems like a lot of money to pay for a less than welcoming reception and a tiny room. The bathroom was small but modern with very nice toiletries and good shower pressure. Bottom line: If you can spring for a more deluxe room with more space and arrive at mid day when your room is ready then I think it is definitely a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: daegwashdc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nearly perfect for our purposes: Very friendly and helpful (and english-speaking staff), very convenient location, free wifi (and free, unlimited internet-based telephone calls back to the US), clean rooms, super-comfortable beds. Rooms are quite small, but mine had an outdoor seating area. Fancy TV, though very limited english-language programming (CNN, but no BBC or Sky, Fox or MSNBC). Really liked the look and feel of the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply delightful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keats575
Reviews.Content: The rooms, location, decor, and cleanliness combine to make this a fabulous hotel. Our room was tastefully decorated and quite spacious by Paris standards. I'm very particular when it comes to cleanliness, and this hotel easily met my standards. The room looked out onto the street and as another reviewer mentioned, you can hear the children at the school next door, but it was never an issue for us. In addition, the street is quiet at night. The garden and fresh flowers throughout the hotel were lovely. The staff were helpful and friendly, and notified us upon arrival that phonecalls (even to North America) were free. The location is ideal. We walked to many shops and restaurants as well as the Louvre, the opera, Musee d'Orsay, Champs Elysees, etc. The neighbourhood never felt unsafe, even when we walked back to the hotel in the dark. I would certainly stay at this hotel again on future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with beautiful staff and garden.”
Reviews.Author: PerthPeter
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Paris for a special birthday. Paris was everything and more that we expected and Villa Madame made our short stay even better. Before we arrived the lovely Camille helped us with advise about hotel and things to do in Paris. Camille and Franc, and the other beautiful staff, were just that beautiful and very, very helpful. Camille even went out of her way to ensure we got a reservation at the last minute to a fully booked restaurant at the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were clean with a comfortable double bed and clean and roomy shower and bathroom. They were very quiet as well even though there is a school right next door. The breakfast was awesome with what ever you ordered no problem and fresh bread and pastries each morning from the nearby bakery. The coutyard had just been upgraded with fresh flowers and plants and the team at the hotel take a lot of pride in the look of the hotel. There is also a beautiful area to read a book and enjoy a coffee infront of an open fire. The hotel is close to many outstanding restaurants, cafes and parks. Plus it is in a great area for shopping and close to all tourist spots. What more can I say....this is one of the best hotels that we have ever stayed in beacause the staff helped to make it not just a stay, however a very special moment and holiday. Thank you very much Villa Madame. And Camille and Franc, we can not wait to come back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made my stay in paris a great memory”
Reviews.Author: 4482TheJoe
Reviews.Content: I never thought a hotel could change the quality of your stay as much as it did! My Mom and i traveled here in February. We booked last minute - the day before. When we got there, they had up graded us to a suite. The staff was extremly helpful, and the hotel was a beautiful gem. It wasnt stuffy at all, wasnt grand, but it was Paris Chic. What we were looking for! Breakfast was great, and the rooms were awesome. Beds and sheets we good too. We travel to paris often, and usually stay at this other hotel, but from now on, this is the only place i will want to stay at! I just loved everything about it. The ONLY thing that wasnt the best but was definitly not something to make you want to turn away was the foam on top of the quality matress. My mother's guess was that when we mistaked that a kid was coming, they thought that maybe i was a baby, and going to make a mistake on the bed! I will definitly go back. If you are looking for the French experience and great service, comfortable beds, this is the place to go. Very cozy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: David_Bole
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and almost needs to shout a little louder about the quality of service. Great location close to St Germain des Pres, excellent staff, understated service and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: TRav100
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for 3 nights in Paris as part of a 50th birthday surprise. I was very pleased with what he had chosen. We had a deluxe room No46 which was nicely appointed - tempur matrress and high quality linens and pillows gave us a great nights sleep. It did howvere have a seperate toilet from the bathroom - which wouldn't be a problem in itself but there was no washbasin to wash hands after toilet - I didn't like that part - perhaps they could leave alcohol wash. Breakfast was included in our rate and was continental but they did make us fantastic omlettes on request. We learned of the free internet access but no-one explained there was free world calls which we would have taken advantage of if we'd been told - better info at check-in would improve the experience. The courtyard garden was treat to have a drink in the evening and the location of the hotel is excellent. The staff were very nice and accomodating when a request was made. I would defintely like to stay here again if I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MarlsMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We loved it the rooms were nice bed excptional. It is a reasonable stroll to buses and trains in a great quiet area with plenty of good cafes pand resturants

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: radioisotopo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel Very good position . My de Luxe room is very nice and well furnished. The director of the Hotel Franck Delfau is realy professional and in the same time one of the most kind person i had ever met in my trip . His suggestions let us doing a great gastronomic experience in Paris

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodie_on_the_run
Reviews.Content: The hotel was tastefully decorated .Very clean with cool art & floral arrangements. The young woman at reception seem to be put out by our questions, wasn’t all that customer service oriented? When she checked us in she did not make it clear what was included in our room & what wasn’t . We found out at the end of our stay breakfast wasn’t, but internet & calls to anywhere in the world were free (landline). Of course after we started making calls she mentioned calls to cel phones were charged .It seem we were constantly having to ask questions ( how the phone , tv ,or heating worked because I guess the hotel assumes only engineering types only stay there) Over all there was more we liked then disliked about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Beyond our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravellers
Reviews.Content: Villa Madame certainly exceeded our expectations, after reading so many reviews on Trip Advisor we felt a little apprehensive about accommodation in Paris. Like any where & anything the old say "you get what you pay for". On arrival at Villa Madame our check in was very welcoming, we were shown directly to our room. The paper work etc was completed later in the afternoon which I thought was a lovely touch. Our room was a twin bedded room overlooking the pretty courtyard at the rear of the hotel. We were very happy with our room, the beds were really good quality, so comfortable with good linen. The room had a small safe which is a bonus, along with a small fridge. An electric jug in the room would have been fabulous to enable a cup of tea in the evenings, however the young gentleman on reception bought us tea on a tray which was lovely. It was not a bother for him to do so! We found the room more than adequate for storage of our suitcases & belongings packed away into the small wardrobe & drawers provided. The room had extra seating & a small table. The bathroom was a good size, plenty of room for storage of toliet bags etc. Water pressure in the shower was fantastic. Impressed to see a heated towel rail, another bonus. Hermes products in the bathroom made a nice touch! Breakfast was served each morning, more than enough to eat! The presentation of breakfast was lovely, indeed I would say rather stylish! The lounge area & outdoor courtyard at Villa Madame were extremely welcoming & very well put together, a real boutique hotel! The staff at Villa Madame were extremely helpful & proud to assist with anything. They were all proud of the Hotel & there roles within the hotel. We ate at the recommended cafe nearby, the food was fantastic with a good atmosphere. In fact we ate our evening meal there for 2 nights!, along with a lunch. We would recommend Villa Madame, 10/10 - a stylish small boutique hotel with alot of thought gone into the refurbishment of this hotel. Good luck to the owners - we would love to return to stay again some day SOON, but a long way from NZ!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ddtx
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were backbacking through London and Paris and decided to splurge a little on this hotel. It turned out amazing. You really don't want to risk a hostel in Paris, they are serious dumps. I did a hostel in Paris in 2007. I picked this hotel due to it's proximity to nightlife in the Latin Quarter and it looked nice. The bathroom had a walk in shower with glass door. Flatscreen TV had an aux speaker in the bathroom to hear the tv while doing your thing. Beds were very comfortable and the room we got was big and facing the street. The street was loud during mid afternoon due to the Catholic school playground down the block. We booked a room with two singles and when we went to check in we were told they had inadvertantly given our room away. I started to freak because I was sure we would get a fast one pulled as usually happens in western europe. We were happy that after my face of death look we were upgraded to a larger room with two double beds. Unfortunately for the poor lady who had booked the room they bumped her and I don't know where she was then moved. Overall the staff was slow on check'in. Breakfast was carbs and coffee. They have a person dedicated only to breakfast and coffee however it seems odd because this is a very small hotel. We were the youngest guests in the hotel by about 50 years. Everyone else looked like they were late fifties to mid seventee's. We are single thirtysomethings. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a peacefull nights sleep in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “So great... location, staff, service, courtyard...”
Reviews.Author: 2011Bruins
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5-night stay in this fantastic boutique hotel. The location is perfectly situated for those travelers interested in a more local experience and not looking for the immediate access to the tourist scene. Nicolas and the staff were very accommodating throughout our stay. I would definitely suggest an executive room or larger if your stay will be more than a few days… the extra room was especially nice to have for luggage, walking around and overall downtime. The bathroom was great too with a separate shower/tub enabling quicker time getting ready for going out. The patio garden is fantastic for having a drink and conversation (the hotel bar does not serve alcoholic drinks, only coffees, so you’ll need to provide your own beverages). There is lots of shopping and eateries/bakeries nearby… and the hotel’s proximity to Luxembourg Gardens makes this place a secret. The children from the neighboring school did wake us every AM around 9ish… but we were ready to get going anyways, so really no big deal there. The breakfast is basically pastries, fruit and coffee… so make your decision based on that. There is somewhere between 150-200 TV channels, but only 3 were English speaking (CNN International, BBC World, and MTV Germany)… I know this is a small deal, but some people will care. Air-conditioning… I was a bit worried at first, but it stays cool enough for the few hours we were there. The bed was more on the firm side, but overall a pleasant sleeping experience. There are a couple restaurants close by that we would suggest… the little Italian place on Rue Madame (La Giara)… fantastic pasta dishes… perfect for something quick/close by. Then there is Pizza Chic, around the corner from the hotel, maybe 5-min walking distance… coal-oven pies (according to my wife, true to pizza in Italy) and it brought back for me fond memories of my NYC days. Try to take the metro for your commute to/from the airport/train station as a cab ride can quickly become pricey due to distance and traffic. Nicolas and staff- thank you for a great stay... and the basket/flowers were a wonderfully nice treat as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great staff in good location”
Reviews.Author: DJSid33
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a romantic break in Paris. Chose the hotel because of it's location and reviews on trip advisor - lived up to the billing. Smallish, but very comfortable, clean and modern room overlooking the lovely Japanese Garden. Staff were brilliant - friendly and helpful. Excellent location close to good shops and restaurants, and within easy walking distance of most of the tourist attractions of Paris. Couldn't fault the Hotel and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful all the way around”
Reviews.Author: dbattag580
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Villa Madame. The staff was fantastic. All were bilingual. Brekfast at the hotel was wonderful. Very conveniently located. Rooms were small but my wife and I felt like we had lots of room. Bathroom was very modern. Bed was very comfortable. I would definitely go back. Did I say the staff was FANTASTIC !! Dave, Philadelphia PA USA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to enjoy Paris”
Reviews.Author: oscarq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 21 for the start of our european vacation. It was spacious with a king size bed and very quiet,the perfect place to rest up after a long journey from Australia. The staff were helpful and friendly, recommending a place for dinner then ringing to check if we could dine early as we were tired.The decor is amazing with a mixture of old and new, including fabulous flower arrangments in the public areas. It is located within 10 minutes walking of a number of bistros and resturants. However as it was August when we were there a number was closed( the whole of Paris was just tourists). It is located next to a school which may be noisy in school time. The free wi fi worked well and there was also computer access available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: EduardoFernandes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 7 to 12 August. Despite small, the rooms are very comfortable. Aesthetically it is noted that there has been very careful in the reshuffle that was made (according to the director) in October 2008. The sympathy of the entire staff was a constant. If I return to Paris it will be the right place to stay. The only negative note is the breakfast: very limited number of tables and I found the price a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Villa Madame!”
Reviews.Author: bellsj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Madame for 4 nights in late June and would definitely recommend the hotel. It is a new hotel - very clean and the staff was friendly and accomodating. The rooms were a good size and nicely decorated. There are several metro stations within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant retreat”
Reviews.Author: PassportPal24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel! The TV, bathroom, bed, and service was top notch. Despite the small room (my suitcase had to stay on the floor since there was no other place to set it) we enjoyed our stay. I was particuarly impressed with the Hermes products. The location is within walking distance to Metro lines and in the heart of many close eateries. We loved this hotel and would certainly return again (with less luggage)! It was a treat to return to this room after long days exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, w/all the necessary modern upgrades in a classic part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rachelg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by my sister-in-law who has lived in Paris, and visits often. She hates anything touristy, and she loved this place. We stayed the last week in June--VERY hot in Paris that week, and while many eateries, stores, and the metro did not have A/C, the hotel did, working just fine. It is in a PERFECT location of the city--the 6th, very local. The street is near 2-3 metro stops, and just one block from the Luxenbourg Gardens. There is a school next door, but street is dead quiet at night, so light sleepers will be fine. The hotel decor is modern, with a lovely sitting room in the lobby and japanese garden in back. The staff is very friendly & helpful. Very comfortable room, WONDERFUL beds. Nice modern bathrooms, strong shower and deep tub. And outlets in convenient locations throughout (as opposed to a single one- over the sink). Free wifi in the rooms plus one computer to use for free in the living room. They have breakfast at an additional charge--we only had it once, taking full advantage of the cafes in the immediate area--and it was very nice. Great for couples and small groups of friends. Probably not the cheapest hotel to be found, but if you are able to spend 100 euro or so per person, it is worth it. Little things like quality, non-touristy restaurants in the immediate area, a/c in your room when it's 90+ degrees out, modern plumbing, free wifi & internet, 24 hour desk, and a safe quiet street are essential to us when we travel, and the Villa Madame had all this & then some.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indiana1000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated, with a welcoming library style lobby and a wonderful secluded, courtyard garden with fountain. The rooms are typically small, as most hotels are in Paris. The staff are friendly and helpful. But no one here has mentioned, the hotel is right next to an elementary school with a walled playground that shares the outer wall with the hotel. The noise when recess happens is deafening. Don't plan to sleep in past 10 am, when the recess bell rings, or relax at 4 pm in the garden, when the screaming is overpowering. Try not to get room 16. It shares the wall with the elevator and all night long you will hear cables banging next to your head. But it is still a nice hotel -- just go when school lets out!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in the heart of left bank”
Reviews.Author: LiaGreece
Reviews.Content: Recently and beautifully renovated, Villa Madame is a hotel we will return soon. The classic room we stayed at, #24, was a bit small but very comfortable in every aspect. I loved the bathroom where there was plenty of room for all my jars, tubes, bottles ! Very good breakfast, included, very good staff from the floor to the reception...actually there is no classic recption, just a nice desk. The metro is not very close but 3 stations you can choose from.Very good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of Paris- The Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: utkarshmorarka
Reviews.Content: The Villa Madame was a far cry from the fashionable Ritz or the George V, but it was located better than any of the above. Recently renovated, it offered cramped quarters ergonomically designed to provide for everything a guest would need. The Hotel offered few services, but the hospitality was exceptional and the concierge was a pleasure to deal with. The Hotel's location was Ideal, it was in the heart of the Latin Quarter, a short walk or metro ride from any of the sights of Paris, in fact everytime I walked to the metro, I took a different route back and forth and saw new things everytime

Reviews.Title: “Small but excellent. The Villa Madame is our new favorite place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Aelwyn
Reviews.Content: The Villa Madame is a lovely, comfortable, well-located boutique hotel with excellent service. My wife and I enjoyed our stay there immensely. This hotel is chic and luxuriously comfortable especially for the price. Admittedly, the room we had (Classic Double Room) was the smallest hotel room my wife and I had ever seen at about 3m x 3.5m (10' x 12'). The large outdoor terrace, fantastic bathroom (with Hermès products and great water pressure), deliciously comfortable bed, iPod docking station, super-fast free wi-fi and excellent service more than made up for the tiny room. Alex at the front desk was a delight as she answered our every question and was always happy to chat and share information. The location is excellent being only a few minutes walk from either the Rennes or St-Sulpice Metro stops, 100m from the beautiful Jardin du Luxembourg and within easy walking distance of the myriad of shops and restaurants on both the Rue de Rennes and Boulevard Saint-Germain. The hotel serves a decent continental breakfast which seems expensive at 18€ but we found a package that was below the normal rate and included breakfast. The breakfast room, as other reviewers have noted, is small and has only four tables for two. All of the tables were occupied each time we went for breakfast but the hotel happily served us as we sat in the little lounge area so it wasn't ever a problem. They don't serve lunch or dinner but there are two brasseries within 50m of the front door and many more restaurants and coffee shops just a few blocks away. There were a few other minor concerns that I had regarding this hotel: - The minibar is stocked only with two bottles of water. It would be nice if there was a limited selection of other beverages and also a kettle for tea/coffee service. - The satellite television has almost 900 channels (yes, I went through them all late one night) but half of them are Arabic and almost all of the rest are in French save for one German language station, a couple of Italian stations and only Bloomberg for the English speakers. Although one doesn't go to Paris to watch TV in the room, it's nice to relax and watch the news or a movie after a long day on the town but unless the above suits you, you won't have much cause to even turn on the set. - The street is very small and it is very difficult to find parking. This is likely not a problem for most visitors but is something to keep in mind especially if you rent a car. Overall, my wife and I loved this hotel. The few cons are heavily outweighed by the comforts we enjoyed. We are very seasoned travelers and despite the tiny room, this hotel experience was one of our best ever. We will definitely stay at the Villa Madame again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kennedy429Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: Spent five wonderful days in Paris and our stay at Villa Madame added to the enjoyment. The hotel is well located and very tastefully decorated in a modern style. Our room - #21, an executive-type, was large (approx. 11 by 18), bright, with three large windows, and very comfortable and clean. We heard so much about small rooms in Paris, and I don't know what other rooms at Villa Madame are like, but we had a queen bed, chaise lounge, small table, desk, and plenty of storage for our things. It was a nice place to relax at the end of the day. The bathroom was large with both tub and shower. Wi-fi and local and international phone calls are included in the price. The breakfast was excellent and although not a buffet it was plentiful - a basket of bread, croissants and jams; cereal (on request), yogurt, fruit salad, juice and coffee. The woman who served us spoke no English, but was very nice and accommodating. Small but lovely common areas - fireplaced living room / dining room, pretty courtyard, and nice breakfast and lounge area. In my opinion, the website doesn't do the hotel justice. The staff did not always have answers to our questions, but they were friendly and always tried to help. Another reviewer mentioned no coffee machine but they are willing to make you coffee upon request. I was very worried about the location but it was perfect. Quiet, residential street but there was a nice pastry shop, very good wine and cheese shop, a cafe and a few restaurants right on the corner. A market was a block away; a laundromat was near St. Sulpice a block or so away (and right near Gerard Mulot pastry!). A couple of metro lines were close by. Luxembourg Gardens around the corner was lovely, and within 5 minutes we were in the heart of St. Germain. It's maybe10-15 minutes to the Seine. If I'm ever lucky enough to return to Paris, I will definitely stay at Villa Madame.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Maddystar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights to kick off our trip to Europe and it was a great start to our holiday. Location is perfect within the St Germain arrondisment (7th), close to a metro stop and within walking distance to Louvre, Musee D'Orsay etc... We arrived before check-in and were greeted warmly, had our bags stored and were directed to a great cafe for a bite to eat while our room was being prepared. We had booked through the hotel's website and found ourselves upgraded to a terrace room which was superb! The terrace itself was fantastic, large with table/chairs as well as a sun lounge surrounded by a superb garden on the top floor. If you looked hard enough you could see the top of the Eiffel Tower which was nice. The room itself was adequate in size, well-appointed with a decent sized bathroom (for Europe), modern and very clean. I can't comment on the breakfast as we preferred to venture out for our meals. As other reviewers have noted, there is a school next door and those parisian kids sure know how to make some noise, but we didn't find it that disruptive. When the kids weren't around it was very quiet and relaxing. We will definitely stay here again. My wife travels to Paris regularly on business and says that this hotel is better than her business accommodation at a fraction of the price. Great room and great location at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: darneesh
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a Hotel is located on a lovely little street around the corner from the Luxombourg Gardens. It has recently been renovated and is beautiful. (Previously the Regents Hotel, where I stayed for many years) The Staff is lovely and courteous and helpful. The breakfast either in the small dining room overlooking the garden courtyard, or in your room is FABULOUS. The best and freshest baguette and croissant in Paris. Free wireless internet is available. My room was divine. Everything is new. The bed and sheets are beyond comfortable. This is my home away from home. I travel to Paris for business and pleasure many times a year for many years, and I honestly can say that I have found my home in Paris. Can not say enough about the warm and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shame about the other guests!”
Reviews.Author: cut2quick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - a quiet street in St Germain near the metro and good shops. The rooms are small but clean and well-decorated with nice toiletries, free wi-fi etc. The breakfast was good, not very cheap but you wouldn't find anything much cheaper outside the hotel either. It's close to lots of restaurants, the staff are friendly and helpful. Sadly, our stay wasn't very restful thanks to some of the other guests, particularly the two teenage American boys in the room next to us. All we heard was doors banging in the early hours, people shouting or adults knocking on their door trying to wake them up early in the morning. It's a terrible generalisation but we've experienced this before: Americans are not considerate hotel guests. They expect the hotel to be spotless and quiet and the staff to be polite but in return they are noisy and rude. We shall be using Trip Advisor with more caution next time...

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Madame
HotelInfo.Address: 44 rue Madame, 75006 Paris, France
